content: Hi, I'd be interested in contributing to Rust. I've looked at the rustc-dev-guide, but I'm struggling a bit to choose a suitable bug to work on. Would https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/87368 or https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/87482 be appropriate for a beginner? I've tried looking at the T-mentor and T-easy issues, but most of those seem to already be assigned or are very old

If you would like to work on those, go ahead ! You can ask questions here if you’re stuck.

If you want something simpler, documentation issues are a great way to get used to navigating the code and discovering where everything is, but it’s not very glamorous so I can understand if that not very appealing

You can also look at issues about rustdoc, it’s simpler to understand than rustc (though @Joshua Nelson may disagree :stuck_out_tongue:)
I would describe it as "smaller but more complicated"
It's easier to find the code that's broken and harder to understand why it's wrong

Thanks, that's good to know ^^
Would a documentation issue be something like this? https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/87238
That does look more doable, I think I'll start with that and then look at one of those other two
